title: baiters/advance_fee/sources/scamorama/naz_desade_evans_green.html
notes: RayNaz has appeared in such scamoscopies as MAGNUM FARCE, THE LOAN RANGER, COME ON, FEEL THE ILLINOISE!, LIGHTS, KAMARA, ACTION, THIS IS YOUR BRAIN ON 419. Naz appears courtesy of Scambaiters Equity.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I am also glad to know that you are ready to work with me and i assume you are a noble and trustworthy person whom I can rely on you for your capabilities to handle this transaction. Like I said before, due to this issue on my hands now, it became necessary for me to seek your assistance, I appreciate the fact that you are ready to assist me in executing this project, and also you will help me in investing my money in your country, I am quite certain about that. 

You should not have anything to worry about, I will do everything legally required to ensure that the project goes smoothly, it shall pass through all Laws of International Banking, and you have my word. Having resolved to entrust this transaction into your hands, I want to remind you that, it needs your commitment and diligent follow up. If you work seriously, the entire transaction should be over in a couple of days.

READ THE FOLLOWING AND GET BACK TO ME:
Firstly, I will want to know precisely the type of occupation that you do and how old you are, you should note that this project is highly capital intensive, this is why I have to be very careful, I need your total devotion and trust to see this through. I know we have not met before, but I am very confident that we will be able to establish the necessary trust that we need to execute this project.

I am now in contact with a foreign online bank; I now intend that you open an account in your name in this foreign bank. The money would be transferred to your account which you will open in the bank for both of us, this is the best way i have found, it will protect us from my bank.

I want us to enjoy this money in peace when we conclude. So you should listen to my instructions and follow them religiously. Also you have to know that I cannot transfer this money in my name as my bank will be aware that it is from me, this is where I need you. As result of this, you will have to open an account in the corresponding bank. 

I will obtain a certificate of deposit from this my bank, it will be issued in your name, and this will make you the bonafide owner of the funds. After this, the money will be banked online for both of us. We can then instruct the bank to transfer our various shares into our respective home bank accounts.

I will also perfect/finance the documentations with the assistance of my attorney to give the transaction the legal right. Before I commence, I will need you to send me a copy of any form your identification (Driver's license Work ID or International passport) and your Name & Current address. I want to be sure that I am transacting with the correct person. As soon as I get these from you, I will commence the paper work. I hope you will understand why I need all these, the money in question is big and I want to ensure that I know you well before I proceed to give you all the details to commence the project, I will send the name and contact details of the bank so that you can commence communication with them.

I have really invested much in this transaction so I will please tell you to accept the 40% while i take 60% of the total funds that I have intend to give to you. For your information I will be coming over to your country for my share of the funds, once the funds is credited in your account at the bank that we will be using for this transaction.

Please endeavor to keep this transaction confidential, Please do not discuss it with anybody, I have a 22year career with my bank (Bank Of England) and I do not intend to ruin all that. I really can't wait till the funds leave my bank because I have not been able to sleep nor eat properly for the past days. Attach to this email is my Staff identity for your reference.

Ensure that you keep this project confidential; do not discuss it with anybody, because of the confidential nature of this transaction and my work.

Please reply soonest.

Regards,
Mr Evans Green

-------------------------------------------------
CONFIDENTIAL FROM BARNSLEY COUNTY BANK PLC. 
This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential Solely and intended for the use of the individual or entity to whom they are addressed. Dissemination, distribution or copying of this e-mail or the information herein by anyone other than the intended recipient, or an employee or agent Responsible for delivering the message to the intended recipient, is Prohibited.

Hello,

Although you might be apprehensive about my email as we have not met before,I am Mr Evans Green,I am a Banker i work with Bank Of England,There is the sum of $20,600,000.00 in my Bank "Bank Of England"London, There were no beneficiaries stated concerning these funds which means no one would ever come forward to claim it.

That is why I ask that we work together so as to have the sum transfered out of my Bank into your Bank Account or any other account of your choice. I will be pleased to see if you can help me and also be a good and trusted person. 
Once the funds have been transferred to your Nominated Bank Account we shall then share in the ratio of 60% for me, 40% for you,do send me a mail as soon as possible for more details here is my private email address: "evansgreen.ir@ir.ae"

Regards
Mr Evans Green

messages.body:
I hope it will be all right if I answer the mail you sent to my colleague. He is on vacation at the present time, but asked me to watch over his mail account. This is why I am answering your letter. I would do just about anything to get out of this low-paying, boring, thankless job I'm in, and with enough money, I could follow my dream.

My friend is in a management position, and earns about 4 times what I earn, so he obviously doesn't need the money, but I sure do. $5 Million would sure put me on Easy Street!! I could tell my fool of a boss to take this job and shove it! Boy, I'd sure like to do that!

Let me know what I have to do, will you? My friend will be vacationing until the 15th, next Sunday, so we can get going with this right away.

Sincerely, Mark E. deSade

My Dear Friend,

Thank you very much for your response, and your interest in this transaction.

I am very very sorry for my inability to respond to your email message sent to me by you on Sunday 8th of November. It was due to my engagements in the Bank of England/World Bank joint conference held in Wales, so i could not check my email box or respond to any message. i hope you accept my apology.

In regards to my proposal to your friend, am surprise that you have access to your friends account, which means that this proposal would not have been safe with him. Do some other persons have access to your email also? That will be one of the criteria that will determine if i will accept your appeal to help me in this proposed transfer.
Is this your personal email account?

i await you.

messages.body:
Dear Evans Green,

Your mail caught me at the very moment I am rushing to prepare for an important event.

I assure you, absolutely NO person (or entity of any kind) can access this mail account except myself. This is MY private mail account, so any correspondence between us is strictly for only me to consider. I hope that answers your concern.

I must go now, but I will return in a few hours, at which time I can be more specific in my response to you. I hope that will be satisfactory.

Sincerely, Mark

[A little stalling...]

messages.body:
Dear Evans Green,

I regret making you wait all this long time, but a few hours is not like the 10 DAYS you made me wait for your reply! You see, the event took more time than I had originally thought it would. I am glad the thing is over, and I am happy that achieved the intended goal was reached. I am a bit non-plussed to say, the guest "star" sustained a few minor injuries, that required a short visit to our small clinic, but she is resting at home now. It certainly has been an interesting day!

To answer a couple of your questions, I am a single man, 42 years old, and I am engaged to a lovely young woman, Kat M. Andu, we plan to be married in the springtime. I am manager, and part-owner of S&M Entertainment Company, here in Valleyinga, East Dakota. The town is a very small one, not more than 80 people live here. It is so small that most maps don't even spend the ink to print its location! But my partner was born here, his parents live nearby, and since they are getting very old, we must remain close to them.

I discussed this proposition of yours with Kat, and she is all in favor of me joining in partnership with you, as long as it doesn't interfere with my job, or my time with her. She is quite a busy young woman, but she makes a lot of money, and seems to be satisfied with her work. I trust her implicitly, and since this money I will get from your project will set us off in our marriage, she is understandably going to have to be aware of everything I do with you.

However, I haven't said anything to my boss, Stanley Toules, (the business name uses the first letters of our names, which we think is very clever) as I want him to be very shocked when I tell him to shove this job! Stan is not home from vacation yet, I understand there was a little trouble with the local authorities, and he has been thrown into jail. Poor guy, he doesn't take confinement very well, and may go berserk. I will keep you apprised.

I will be waiting to hear from you. Please reply sooner than 10 days the next time you write, waiting is torture!

Sincerely, Mark
messages.raw:
Mark E. deSade

[Then, this evening, I send a mail with more info...]

messages.body:
Hello my dear friend Mark,

Now i am so full of joy that you are such a determined man who can make us have success in this Transaction. I am sorry i could not reply to you earlier i was very busy at the office today, you know Fridays and Saturdays are always very busy days for we bankers, because you have to clear the week's transaction in preparation for a better week ahead.

My dear friend, i carefully read through your message, i am really happy for your decision to assist me in this transfer. and i am more impressed with your Fiancee's consent to my proposal, i assume her to be a good woman for you as a wife though i have not seen her, but i believe she means well for you. Please extend my regards to her.

As for the Transaction to begin fully, i want you to send to me your personal details below, this i will forward to my Bank's Attorney to commence the preparation of the Documents that will Legally Certify you to be the Legal Beneficiary of the Funds. Please i want you to be very understanding with me Mark, because i want to make sure that everything thing i will do for this transaction must be Legal. That is why i have an Attorney beside me to always have an overview of all i do during the course of the Transfer of this Funds out of my Bank.. Send me you details as requested below:

FULL NAME:
ADDRESS:
CITY:
STATE:
COUNTRY:
DIRECT MOBILE/TELEPHONE NUMBER:

Also send to me a scanned copy of your identification, it is very necessary Mark as adviced by my attorney, i will not go against any advice from my attorney, because i want to maintain a Legal pace in this Transfer. I hope you appreciate this.

Please Mark, i want the best result from this partnership of ours.

So my dear friend, i will await your message. I will respond to your message late tomorrow or on monday because i will be out with my family tomorrow to visit my Mum and simblings.

Best regards to you and your lovely wife in prospects. I wish you both all the best in life and marraige.

Have a Lovely Weekend.

Evans Green

messages.body:
Hello, Evans Green,

Here is the information you requested:

FULL NAME: Mark Edward deSade

ADDRESS: 245 W. Pembrook St.

CITY: Valleyinga

STATE: East Dakota, 59847 

COUNTRY: USA

DIRECT MOBILE/TELEPHONE NUMBER: 12024355031


I regret not being able to provide you with a copy of my passport, because of the threat of Identity Theft. It is just too dangerous--not that I mistrust you, understand, but my bank and all those entities who control my financial situation, advise against such a foolish action. I would surely have enormous problems, if that should happen!

I hope you understand.

I will vouch for the fact that I am Mark E. deSade, I looked into the mirror, and sure enough, it was me!

I'm sure your attorney has his reasons for such a request, and I do not know if Identity Theft is a huge problem in your country, but it certainly is, here! I can't stress this denial any more strongly, I hope you will understand my point of view.

I don't have a mobile phone, as they are very intrusive at the most inconvenient times, but there is an answering machine. I may or may not get any message from it, and the easiest way for us to communicate, is by the e-mail. I have my laptop with me at all times, so I will be easier to reach by mail.

Please reply in the affirmative. I would hate to see this deal scrubbed, for this minor detail.

Sincerely, Mark

messages.subject: REHello my dear friend Mark
messages.body:
Dear Friend Mark Edward DeSade,

Thank you my dear brother for your response, and the information therein. I am sorry for the delay thus far, it was due to the much days taken by the Lawyer to prepare the Documents. Thank God that the Documents are ready.

I have received the Documents prepared by my Lawyer this morning, i have attached to this message Scanned copies of the Documents.

Considering the money involved, it is necessary for me to be sure of the person to whom I will be entrusting this transaction, my trust is not given out lightly. What I expect from you is trust and commitment; I want this large sum of money transferred with your assistance.

Furthermore, with regards to the legality of this transaction, I must let you know that this transaction is real and risk free, it shall be done in accordance with banking Laws and regulations, as you are aware My bank Attorney has handle the entire documentations.

As a matter of fact I have taking care of the cost of retaining the services of the Attorney, certain beaks have to be watered in a transaction like this. I have taking care of the expenses of the Lawyer Charges and i will also be taking care of the Cost of Transferring the Funds, but it is necessary for me to let you know that you will be required to take care of the cost of opening the account with the bank i will be instructing you to contact for a (offshore/on-line account) below.

You are required to contact the bank, send the bank an email or call and make enquiries on (offshore/on-line account) opening, like I said earlier that you will open an account via online With the bank(BARNSLEY COUNTY BANK PLC UK) so that as soon as you open the account with the bank in your name, i will immediately wire the funds there. Transfer will be seen as in-house. (Same telex type and banking coordinates with my Bank). You can then transfer the funds in safe bits to your main account for both of us.

Please find below the banks details:

Bank Name: BARNSLEY COUNTY BANK PLC UK.
Bank Address: Barnsley County Towers,14 Broadway Bradford, BD1 1EZ,
United Kingdom.
Bank E-mail: info.barnsleycounty@onlinebarnsleynet.com

Contact Person
Bank Manager
Mr David Barker
Tel: +44-701-113-9092
Fax: +44-700-606-5058

You are required to contact the bank via email and make enquiries on (offshore/on-line account) and get me posted as soon as you contact the bank.

I have attached to this message the scanned copies of the Document prepared by the Attorney.

I hope you understand.

Regards
Mr Evans Green

messages.body:
BARNSLEY COUNTY BANK PLC UK. Barnsley County Towers 14 Broadway Bradford, BD1 1EZ UK

Dear Mr. David Barker,

I have been directed to your establishment by one Evans Green, he tells me that you are in need of some documentation. Will you kindly provide the proper instruments, so that I can proceed with my immediate participation?

I'm not certain in this, but I suspect that his advice is a bit on the side of not being entirely "on the up-and-up".

He writes: "...as soon as you open the account with the bank in your name, i will immediately wire the funds there. Transfer will be seen as in-house. (Same telextype and banking coordinates with my Bank..."

This has aroused some curiosity in me, and in my financée, Kat. We wonder about the legality of "being seen as in-house". Does this have to do with the suspicion that the transfer of such a large amount of money would garner?

If that is the case, I assure you that the idea of being brought up on some bank fraud charges, sends me into paroxysms of worry. The spectre of being thrown in prison for who-knows-how-long, expecially in another country, is torture!

I hope you can allay these fears, before we progress any farther, perhaps you can provide me some information about your bank? I would certainly appreciate such co-operation.

Sincerely, Mark E. deSade

This has aroused some curiosity in me, and in my financée, Kat. We wonder about the legality of "being seen as in-house". Does this have to do with the suspicion that the transfer of such a large amount of money would garner?

If that is the case, I assure you that the idea of being brought up on some bank fraud charges, sends me into paroxysms of worry. The spectre of being thrown in prison for who-knows-how-long, expecially in another country, is torture!

I hope you can allay these fears, before we progress any farther, perhaps you can provide me some information about your bank? I would certainly appreciate such co-operation.

Sincerely, Mark E. deSade

messages.body:
Dear Evans Green,

My lovely Kat returns her greetings, and is looking forward to meeting you soon--in fact, I think she's TOO anxious to meet you! She seems to be quite "turned on" by the prospect of knowing someone who will make us very rich!

I regret the fact that I first told you that I couldn't provide a copy of my passport, because of the threat of ID theft, when the truth is, I do not have a valid passport. It has expired, and to try to renew it, or obtain a new one, would take several weeks, and I presume from the urgent tone of your mails, that time is quickly running out.

Mr. David Barker made it clear in his mail concerning the charges that his bank requires, that there was only a 3-day window of opportunity to claim this fortune, so therein lies the dilemma.

Your advice?

Sincerely, Mark E. deSade

I am sending this mail to both of you, as time is of the essence on my side. Every other host issues an invitation to dinner, but I have been commanded to attend holiday dinner at the home of my boss/partner Stan. So Kat and I will be leaving in just a few minutes, so that we can stop at the market, and purchase a few of bottles of wine, to complement the food. I was commanded to do this, too. Stan likes to start drinking well before the meal, so he is very "well-lubricated" by the time we sit down to eat.

In my opinion, most times Stan is the biggest JERK in the world, but when it comes to cooking, he takes the prize! You'd think he was the only man on Earth who can roast a turkey, and most of the time, the food is so over-cooked, and nearly too dry to eat--you need to wash it down with the wine!

I plan to go to the Western Union office tomorrow, there is none in our small town, so I will have to drive to the next town down the highway, a distance of about 40 miles, so the trip takes some time. I will let you know when I leave, and when I return.

Thank you for your patience.

Sincerely, Mark E. deSade

messages.body:
Dear Evans Green,

To answer your questions:

First, I haven't told Stan anything about our deal, because I want him to be shocked and surprised when I tell him to take this job and shove it. Besides, I remember your mail that stressed confidentiality. You can trust me to keep my mouth closed about our deal until the right time, which I will do.

Yes, we had an interesting time with Stanley and his new girlfriend, Phyllis. Man, is SHE an ODDBALL! Let me tell you what she did. It's a good thing she took this picture of me and Kat before the explosion and fire.

Remember I told you Stan drinks a lot of wine? Phyllis drinks so much, she makes Stan look like a tea-totaller! They had bought a case of wine, (and he still commanded me to bring MORE) and even before they started cooking dinner, they had drunk 2 bottles of it, so they were pretty well "lit up" by the time to put the turkey in the oven. She had turned the heat up to 475, and didn't turn it down to 325 when she was supposed to, and then a disaster! We all barely got out of the house alive!

Long story short, the turkey exploded, and the fat from it caught fire, and burned all the food, the kitchen was destroyed, and that part of Stan's house (really, a mansion) burnt to the ground. The fire probably caused about $75,000 damage, according to the Fire Chief. All in all, 3 big firetrucks were called to put out the fire, which took 3 hours to do!

Then, Phyllis thought it would be fun to perform a strip-tease dance for the fire-fighters, so in a few minutes she was naked as the day she was born, cavorting all over the front lawn. I told you she was drunk, didn't I? It was quite a sight to see, especially in the 25°, snowy early afternoon.

Needless to say, the local cops, Russ and Dan, arrested all of us, but they kept Stan on a charge of drunk and disorderly, and they let Kat and me go, because we hadn't done anything wrong, and we'd only had 1 glass of wine before all the excitement. Now Phyllis is still in jail (wrapped in a blanket) and Stan is going to wrangle with the insurance guy about a settlement.
